summary: Alfred S Hack was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents available are payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to November 1978. These reports list Hack's name, position, and salary during this period. The documents do not specify Hack's exact role within the HSCA or any specific contributions to the investigation into the JFK assassination, but they confirm his employment during a significant period of the committee's operation.
significance: Alfred S Hack's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his role is not detailed in these documents, his presence on the payroll indicates his involvement in the committee's activities.
